plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to eastern Asia, known for its beautiful, large, rose-like flowers. It blooms in cooler months and is prized in gardens for its winter and early spring flowers.
plants.location: East Asia, cultivated worldwide in mild temperate zones
plants.funFact: Camellias were one of the favorite flowers of Queen Victoria and symbolize admiration and perfection.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant native to mountainous regions of Europe, noted for its white flowers that bloom in winter, often appearing around Christmas time.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas Rose is not a rose but named for the rose-like shape of its flowers.

plants.name: Eucalyptus pauciflora
plants.description: A cold-tolerant eucalyptus tree native to alpine regions of southeastern Australia, known to flower during the austral summer months including December, with clusters of white flowers attracting many pollinators.
plants.funFact: Snow Gums withstand heavy snow and icy conditions where few other trees thrive.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub found in Mediterranean climates, Oleander blooms profusely in mild winter climates, including December in subtropical zones, producing clusters of fragrant tubular flowers.
plants.bloomingSeason: May to December (extended blooming in warm areas)
plants.funFact: Oleander is extremely toxic if ingested but has been used historically in traditional medicine with care.
